# QXO, Inc. (QXO) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

QXO is the largest publicly traded distributor of roofing, waterproofing, and complementary building products in North America following its $11 billion acquisition of Beacon Roofing Supply, Inc., completed in April 2025. The company was formerly known as SilverSun Technologies, Inc. and changed its name to QXO, Inc. in June 2024.

Led by serial acquirer Brad Jacobs, QXO is executing a consolidation strategy in the $800B building products' distribution industry. The company aims to become the tech-enabled leader in the approximately $800 billion building products distribution industry and generate outsized value for shareholders, targeting nearly $50 billion in annual revenues within the next decade through strategic acquisitions and organic growth.

QXO offers asphalt, metal roofing, wood roofing, tile roofing, slate roofing, roofing accessories, and roofing insulation products; vinyl siding, aluminum siding, steel siding, fiber cement siding, wood and composite siding, trim and accessories, and gutters and accessories; as well as building materials and supplies, such as exterior materials, interior materials, and tools and equipment. It serves contractors, distributors, and suppliers to streamline operations.

## 2. Current Market Data

• **Stock Price**: As of January 25, 2026, QXO stock fluctuated between $23.36 and $24.48, with current price at $23.95 and market cap of $16.88B
• **52-Week Range**: $11.85 - $26.24
• **Analyst Rating**: According to 13 analysts, the average rating is "Strong Buy" with a 12-month price target of $33.17, representing a 39.31% increase from the latest price

## 3. Existing Products/Services

**Core Distribution Products:**
• Roofing: Asphalt, metal, wood, tile, slate roofing materials and accessories
• Siding: Vinyl, aluminum, steel, fiber cement, wood and composite siding products
• Waterproofing: Built-up roofing, modified roofing, EPDM roofing, PVC roofing, low-slope metal roofing, air and vapor barriers, fluid-applied products
• Building Materials: Exterior and interior materials, tools and equipment, roof hatches and tri-built products

**Technology Services:**
• Software solutions for accounting, financial reporting, enterprise resource planning, warehouse management systems, customer relationship management, and business intelligence
• Consulting and professional services, including specialized programming, training and technical support

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Digital Transformation Initiatives:**
QXO is embedding artificial intelligence across its operations, from quoting and routing to machine-learning demand forecasting. The company is upgrading its enterprise resource planning, warehouse and transportation management systems, and business intelligence tools to provide real-time visibility into orders, inventory, and logistics.

**Technology Platform Enhancements:**
• Centralized digital pricing platform with stricter override controls
• New compensation plans that tie pay to both sales and profitability
• Improved inventory accuracy and product availability to gain market share

## 5. Growth Strategy

QXO's stated goal is reaching $50 billion in revenue through a multi-pronged approach:

**Acquisition Strategy:**
• $1.2 billion convertible preferred equity investment from Apollo Global Management to fund qualifying acquisitions through July 15, 2026
• Expanded to $3 billion total financing with additional investors including Temasek
• Currently evaluating roughly 20 potential targets, with seven in deep, late-stage talks, including mid-sized companies ($1-5B revenue) and larger transformational acquisitions (>$5B revenue)

**Operational Excellence:**
• Transformation program targeting sales, pricing, procurement, logistics, and organizational design, including rebranding branches and cutting corporate layers from nine to four
• Focus on repair and remodel segment (80% of revenue), concentrating on U.S. market with Canada as secondary priority

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

• Primary clients include contractors, distributors, and suppliers
• Through Beacon acquisition, QXO gained access to 8,000+ employees and a coast-to-coast distribution network
• Beacon operates 580 branches across the United States and Canada, distributing to roofing contractors and building materials suppliers

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**2024 Financial Results:**
• Revenue: $56.87 million (4.32% increase from $54.52 million in 2023), Net Loss: -$23.03 million
• Q4 2024: Loss of $(0.02) per share, Full year 2024: Loss of $(0.11) per share
• Cash Position: $5.1 billion in cash on hand with no debt as of December 31, 2024

**Key Metrics:**
• Trailing twelve month revenue: $4.66B, EPS: -$0.44
• Price-to-earnings ratio: -54.14

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds:**
• U.S. housing market characterized as a "coiled spring" with pent-up demand, poised for explosive growth if mortgage rates and regulations ease
• Beacon positioned as stable platform with strong repair-and-remodel component tied to aging U.S. housing and commercial building stock
• Industry has generated compound annual revenue growth of 7% over the last five years with powerful secular growth drivers

**Headwinds:**
• Current macroeconomic environment includes slower new construction activity, combined with higher labor and insurance costs pressuring margins across the sector
• Integration risks from acquisitions, as the building products sector is deeply local and relationship-driven

## 9. Market Shares

The Home Depot and Lowe's dominate the building materials industry with sales of roughly $159.5 billion and $83.6 billion respectively as of 2024, while QXO's vision is to become the third-largest player in the industry. The Beacon acquisition made QXO the largest publicly traded distributor of roofing, waterproofing, and complementary building products in the United States.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**Key Competitors:**
• ABC Supply, SRS Distribution, and Builders FirstSource
• Home Depot and Lowe's as industry giants

**Competitive Positioning:**
Analysts believe QXO can "fundamentally reshape building products distribution" with Brad Jacobs' proven value creation track record and QXO's strategy to "digitize a fragmented sector, aggressively scale, and improve operating margins". The deal is expected to accelerate digital and logistics modernization across the industry, forcing competitors to respond more aggressively.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Major Transaction:**
• April 2025: Completed $11 billion acquisition of Beacon Roofing Supply for $124.35 per share
• Financing included $830 million equity private placement and advisor team led by Morgan Stanley

**Failed Acquisition Attempts:**
• Attempted to buy GMS for roughly $5 billion, but Home Depot purchased the company for $5.5 billion in September 2025

## 12. Recent Developments

**Key Recent Events:**

• **January 12, 2026**: QXO upsized its convertible preferred equity placement to $3 billion, with Apollo, Temasek, and other investors

• **January 15, 2026**: QXO announced pricing of 31.6 million share common stock offering at $23.80 per share

• **December 15, 2025**: Brad Jacobs announced he will step down from chairman roles at XPO and GXO Logistics effective December 31, 2025, to focus more energy on QXO

• **September 2025**: QXO accelerated digital transformation efforts following Beacon acquisition, launching comprehensive transformation program targeting all business operations

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Investment Strengths:**
• Proven leadership with Brad Jacobs' track record of building billion-dollar companies
• Strong financial position with $5.1B+ cash and no debt
• Market leadership position in attractive, recession-resistant sector
• Clear acquisition pipeline and financing secured
• Technology-driven transformation of traditional industry

**Risk Factors:**
• Current unprofitability and integration challenges
• High execution risk given aggressive growth targets
• Dependence on construction market cycles
• Competition from retail giants Home Depot and Lowe's

**Buy Rating**: 7.5/10

**Rationale**: QXO represents a compelling growth opportunity with proven leadership, strong financial backing, and a clear strategy to consolidate and digitize a fragmented industry. While execution risk exists, the combination of Jacobs' track record, substantial cash position, and secured financing for future acquisitions provides a solid foundation. The company's focus on the resilient repair/remodel segment and technology transformation offers defensive characteristics with significant upside potential.

**Estimated Fair Value**: $32-35 per share

This valuation is based on the company's potential to achieve its $50 billion revenue target by 2030, apply industry-standard EBITDA multiples to a consolidated, technology-enhanced distribution platform, and factor in the substantial cash position and acquisition financing. The current analyst consensus target of $33.17 aligns with this assessment, suggesting the stock offers meaningful upside potential for growth-oriented investors with moderate risk tolerance.
tldr_summary:
QXO is a leading North American distributor of roofing, waterproofing, and building products, recently expanded through the $11 billion Beacon Roofing Supply acquisition. Led by serial acquirer Brad Jacobs, the company aims to consolidate and digitize the $800 billion building products distribution industry through strategic acquisitions and technology-driven transformation.

Key highlights include a coast-to-coast distribution network with 580 branches, a robust acquisition strategy backed by $3 billion in financing from Apollo Global Management and Temasek, and an aggressive digital modernization plan embedding AI across operations. The company focuses on the repair and remodel segment, which represents 80% of revenue, and is positioning itself as a technology-enabled industry leader targeting $50 billion in annual revenues within a decade.

With a strong cash position, proven leadership, and a clear growth strategy, QXO receives a 7.5/10 buy rating with an estimated fair value of $32-35 per share, representing significant upside potential for growth-oriented investors.
